New Records: It was Scotland's first T20I victory over Namibia.
Key Match Events: Richie Berrington sealed the deal with a maximum in the second-last over.
Berrington and Michael Leask stepped up and steered Scotland back on course after falling to 73/4.
Berrington punished an unbeaten 47 off 35 balls.
Namibia's captain Gerhard Erasmus hit a powerful 52 from 31 balls.
Brad Wheal had JP Kotze caught for a duck.
Jan Frylinck dragged a Brad Currie delivery onto his stumps.
Nikolaas Davin holed out off Chris Sole.
Zane Green came up with an intelligent piece of play behind the stumps to have Brandon McMullen caught out of his crease.
Matthew Cross was done plumb LBW.
Leask hit a six to take the Scots over the 100 mark.
A 19-run flurry in the 17th over had Scotland firmly within grasp of the win.
Leask was removed in the 18th over, leaving Berrington to finish the job.
Pre-Game Insights: Namibia won the toss and opted to bat first.
The match was played at an overcast but dry Bridgetown.
Post-Match Reflections: Scotland now gives themselves a chance to deny either Australia or England a path into the second round.
Namibia's now one win, one loss, having claimed a dramatic Super Over win over Oman earlier in the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Group B action continues on June 8, with Australia taking on England in an enormous showdown.
